DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Glomerular Filtration Rate Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute per 1.73 m2 of Body Surface Area Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place milliliter per minute per 1.73 m2 of body surface area numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of glomerular filtration rate in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Glomerular Filtration Rate Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for a kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: A kidney function test that measures the fluid volume that is filtered from the kidney glomeruli to the Bowman's capsule per unit of time.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute per 1.73 m2 of Body Surface Area Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit used in the calculation of a rate of the substance removal from the body (such as creatinine clearance) for the measurement of renal excretory function, with the applied correction factor for body size. It is also used as a dose delivery rate calculation unit equal to the rate, at which one milliliter of medication is delivered during a period of time equal to one minute per 1.73 square meters of body surface area._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Milliliter per Minute per 1.73 m2 of Body Surface Area Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit used in the calculation of a rate of the substance removal from the body (such as creatinine clearance) for the measurement of renal excretory function, with the applied correction factor for body size. It is also used as a dose delivery rate calculation unit equal to the rate, at which one milliliter of medication is delivered during a period of time equal to one minute per 1.73 square meters of body surface area.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

Concepts.longName: Milliliter per Minute per 1.73 m2 of Body Surface Area
Concepts.definition: A unit used in the calculation of a rate of the substance removal from the body (such as creatinine clearance) for the measurement of renal excretory function, with the applied correction factor for body size. It is also used as a dose delivery rate calculation unit equal to the rate, at which one milliliter of medication is delivered during a period of time equal to one minute per 1.73 square meters of body surface area.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
